intro: Diplopenta leptocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplopenta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
